page.title: 04AUCTION MART.
page.content: Long ago when the Hawick Auction Mart first started in l8l7, it was conducted behind the Tower Hotel. Later in l883 the Mart was moved to its present location. Mr. Kenneth Oliver who is the owner has worked there for 53 years. The man who told us about it said that you have to be experienced for this job. In the olden days it cost half a crown for a poor cow. Nowadays it costs between Â£8O and Â£lOO. In season there is a sale every Wednesday when they sell fatstock. Every other Thursday there is a sale - these are store sales (mixture of cattle). The Aucion Mart used to sell young pigs and calves but nowadays farms are more mechanised and there aren't as many farms that keep young calves and pigs to fatten up so there are not as many to sell in the sales.
